statement: Scaling requires a provider-abstracted batching service that supports staged batches (gen then critic), centralized rate limiting, `llm_requests`/`llm_batches`/`llm_batch_items`, and per-request idempotency for partial retries.
rationale: Workflow durability patterns exist and user requires provider batch APIs; staged batching is needed to gate critic passes on accepted generations.
keyAssumptions: Provider batch APIs allow polling or webhook completion per batch.
validationCriteria: Blueprint defines staged batch flow and per-request retry without resetting completed items.
critiquePoints: Provider batch API semantics differ and may not support webhooks or fine-grained status.
questions: Do we implement polling-only first with webhook as optional adapter?
How do we surface partial failures to rerun only failed items?
